EvaluationArgument.name: EvaluationArgument
EvaluationArgument.documentation: Represents event-specific properties. Refer to the events documentation for the lists of initial properties: - [DragEvent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DragEvent/DragEvent) - [FocusEvent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FocusEvent/FocusEvent) - [KeyboardEvent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/KeyboardEvent) - [MouseEvent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/MouseEvent) - [PointerEvent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PointerEvent/PointerEvent) - [TouchEvent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TouchEvent/TouchEvent) - [Event](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/Event)

PageFunction.name: PageFunction
PageFunction.signature: type PageFunction<Arg, R> = string | ((arg: Unboxed<Arg>) => R);

Unboxed.name: Unboxed
Unboxed.signature: type Unboxed<Arg> = Arg extends [infer A0, infer A1] ? [Unboxed<A0>, Unboxed<A1>] : Arg extends [infer A0, infer A1, infer A2] ? [Unboxed<A0>, Unboxed<A1>, Unboxed<A2>] : Arg extends [infer A0, infer A1, infer A2, infer A3] ? [Unboxed<A0>, Unboxed<A1>, Unboxed<A2>, Unboxed<A3>] : Arg extends Array<infer T> ? Array<Unboxed<T>> : Arg extends object ? { [Key in keyof Arg]: Unboxed<Arg[Key]> } : Arg;

CPUProfile.name: CPUProfile
CPUProfile.documentation: CPUProfile is the mandatory input to be passed into Page's `throttleCPU` method.

rate.name: rate
rate.documentation: rate as a slowdown factor (1 is no throttle, 2 is 2x slowdown, etc).

NetworkProfile.name: NetworkProfile
NetworkProfile.documentation: NetworkProfile is the mandatory input to be passed into Page's `throttleNetwork` method.

latency.name: latency
latency.documentation: Minimum latency from request sent to response headers received (ms).

download.name: download
download.documentation: Maximal aggregated download throughput (bytes/sec). -1 disables download throttling.

upload.name: upload
upload.documentation: Maximal aggregated upload throughput (bytes/sec). -1 disables upload throttling.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.documentation: Maximum time in milliseconds. Pass 0 to disable the timeout. Default is overridden by the setDefaultTimeout option on `BrowserContext` or `Page`. Defaults to 30000.

strict.name: strict
strict.documentation: When `true`, the call requires selector to resolve to a single element. If given selector resolves to more than one element, the call throws an exception. Defaults to `false`.

delay.name: delay
delay.documentation: Delay between events in milliseconds. Defaults to 0.

ElementHandleOptions.name: ElementHandleOptions
ElementHandleOptions.signature: type ElementHandleOptions = { /** * Setting this to `true` will bypass the actionability checks (visible, * stable, enabled). Defaults to `false`. */ force?: boolean; /** * If set to `true` and a navigation occurs from performing this action, it will not wait for it to complete. * Defaults to `false`. */ noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions;

ElementHandlePointerOptions.name: ElementHandlePointerOptions
ElementHandlePointerOptions.signature: type ElementHandlePointerOptions = ElementHandleOptions & { /** * Setting this to `true` will perform the actionability checks without * performing the action. Useful to wait until the element is ready for the * action without performing it. Defaults to `false`. */ trial?: boolean; };

ElementClickOptions.name: ElementClickOptions
ElementClickOptions.signature: type ElementClickOptions = ElementHandlePointerOptions & { /** * A point to use relative to the top left corner of the element. If not supplied, * a visible point of the element is used. */ position?: { x: number; y: number }; };

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.documentation: `Alt`, `Control`, `Meta` or `Shift` modifiers keys pressed during the action. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

KeyboardPressOptions.name: KeyboardPressOptions
KeyboardPressOptions.signature: type KeyboardPressOptions = & { /** * If set to `true` and a navigation occurs from performing this action, it * will not wait for it to complete. Defaults to `false`. */ noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & EventSequenceOptions & TimeoutOptions;

MouseClickOptions.name: MouseClickOptions
MouseClickOptions.signature: type MouseClickOptions = { /** * The mouse button to use during the action. * Defaults to `left`. */ button?: MouseButton; } & EventSequenceOptions;

MouseMultiClickOptions.name: MouseMultiClickOptions
MouseMultiClickOptions.signature: type MouseMultiClickOptions = MouseClickOptions & { /** * The number of times the action is performed. * Defaults to 1. */ clickCount?: number; };

button.name: button
button.documentation: The mouse button to use during the action. Defaults to `left`.

ContentLoadOptions.name: ContentLoadOptions
ContentLoadOptions.signature: type ContentLoadOptions = { /** * When to consider operation succeeded, defaults to `load`. Events can be * either: * - `'domcontentloaded'` - consider operation to be finished when the * `DOMContentLoaded` event is fired. * - `'load'` - consider operation to be finished when the `load` event is * fired. * - `'networkidle'` - **DISCOURAGED** consider operation to be finished * when there are no network connections for at least `500` ms. Don't use * this method for testing especially with chatty websites where the event * may never fire, rely on web assertions to assess readiness instead. */ waitUntil?: LifecycleEvent; } & TimeoutOptions;

NavigationOptions.name: NavigationOptions
NavigationOptions.signature: type NavigationOptions = { /** * Referer header value. */ referer?: string; } & ContentLoadOptions;

startTime.name: startTime
startTime.documentation: Request start time in milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC

domainLookupStart.name: domainLookupStart
domainLookupStart.documentation: Time immediately before the browser starts the domain name lookup for the resource. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

domainLookupEnd.name: domainLookupEnd
domainLookupEnd.documentation: Time immediately after the browser ends the domain name lookup for the resource. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

connectStart.name: connectStart
connectStart.documentation: Time immediately before the user agent starts establishing the connection to the server to retrieve the resource. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

secureConnectionStart.name: secureConnectionStart
secureConnectionStart.documentation: Time immediately before the browser starts the handshake process to secure the current connection. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

connectEnd.name: connectEnd
connectEnd.documentation: Time immediately after the user agent establishes the connection to the server to retrieve the resource. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

requestStart.name: requestStart
requestStart.documentation: Time immediately before the browser starts requesting the resource from the server, cache, or local resource. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

responseStart.name: responseStart
responseStart.documentation: Time immediately after the browser receives the first byte of the response from the server, cache, or local resource. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

responseEnd.name: responseEnd
responseEnd.documentation: Time immediately after the browser receives the last byte of the resource or immediately before the transport connection is closed, whichever comes first. The value is given in milliseconds relative to `startTime`, -1 if not available.

issuer.name: issuer
issuer.documentation: Common Name component of the Issuer field. The value is extracted from the certificate. This should only be used for informational purposes.

protocol.name: protocol
protocol.documentation: The specific TLS protocol used. For example `TLS 1.3`.

subjectName.name: subjectName
subjectName.documentation: Common Name component of the Subject field. The value is extracted from the certificate. This should only be used for informational purposes.

validFrom.name: validFrom
validFrom.documentation: Unix timestamp (in seconds) specifying the exact date/time when this cert becomes valid.

validTo.name: validTo
validTo.documentation: Unix timestamp (in seconds) specifying the exact date/time when this cert becomes invalid.

sanList.name: sanList
sanList.documentation: String with hex encoded SHA256 fingerprint of the certificate. The value is extracted from the certificate.

x.name: x
x.documentation: The x coordinate of the element in pixels. (0, 0) is the top left corner of the viewport.

y.name: y
y.documentation: The y coordinate of the element in pixels. (0, 0) is the top left corner of the viewport.

width.name: width
width.documentation: The width of the element in pixels.

height.name: height
height.documentation: The height of the element in pixels.

path.name: path
path.documentation: The file path to save the image to. The screenshot type will be inferred from file extension.

omitBackground.name: omitBackground
omitBackground.documentation: Hide default white background and allow capturing screenshots with transparency. Not applicable to `jpeg` images.

quality.name: quality
quality.documentation: The quality of the image, between 0-100. Not applicable to `png` images.

PollingMethod.name: PollingMethod
PollingMethod.documentation: Methods to periodically check for a value. - `raf` - use `requestAnimationFrame` callback to poll - `mutation` - use a mutation observer - `interval` - use a polling interval

polling.name: polling
polling.documentation: If `polling` is `'raf'`, then `pageFunction` is constantly executed in `requestAnimationFrame` callback. If the `polling` is `'mutation'` it will be called when a change is made to the DOM tree. If `polling` is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds at which the function would be executed. Defaults to `raf`.

state.name: state
state.documentation: The element state to filter for.

BrowserPermissions.name: BrowserPermissions
BrowserPermissions.documentation: BrowserPermissions defines all the possible permissions that can be granted to the browser application.

bypassCSP.name: bypassCSP
bypassCSP.documentation: Setting this to `true` will bypass a page's Content-Security-Policy. Defaults to `false`.

colorScheme.name: colorScheme
colorScheme.documentation: Emulates `'prefers-colors-scheme'` media feature, supported values are `'light'`, `'dark'`, and `'no-preference'`. Default to `'light'`.

deviceScaleFactor.name: deviceScaleFactor
deviceScaleFactor.documentation: Sets the resolution ratio in physical pixels to the resolution in CSS pixels i.e. if set higher than 1, then images will look sharper on high pixel density screens. Defaults to 1.

extraHTTPHeaders.name: extraHTTPHeaders
extraHTTPHeaders.documentation: Contains additional HTTP headers to be sent with every request, where the keys are HTTP headers and values are HTTP header values. Defaults to null.

geolocation.name: geolocation
geolocation.signature: geolocation?: { /** * latitude should be between -90 and 90. */ latitude: number; /** * longitude should be between -180 and 180. */ longitude: number; /** * accuracy should only be a non-negative number. Defaults to 0. */ accuracy: number; };
geolocation.documentation: Sets the user's geographical location. Defaults to null.
geolocation.type: { latitude: number; longitude: number; accuracy: number; }

hasTouch.name: hasTouch
hasTouch.documentation: Whether to simulate a device with touch events. Defaults to `false`.

httpCredentials.name: httpCredentials
httpCredentials.documentation: Sets the credentials for HTTP authentication using Basic Auth.

ignoreHTTPSErrors.name: ignoreHTTPSErrors
ignoreHTTPSErrors.documentation: Whether to ignore HTTPS errors that may be caused by invalid certificates. Defaults to `false`.

isMobile.name: isMobile
isMobile.documentation: Whether to simulate a mobile device. Defaults to `false`.

javaScriptEnabled.name: javaScriptEnabled
javaScriptEnabled.documentation: Whether to activate JavaScript support for the context. Defaults to `false`.

locale.name: locale
locale.documentation: Specifies the user's locale following ICU locale (e.g. 'en_US'). Defaults to host system locale.

offline.name: offline
offline.documentation: Whether to emulate an offline network. Defaults to `false`.

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.documentation: Permissions to grant for the context's pages. Defaults to null.

reducedMotion.name: reducedMotion
reducedMotion.documentation: Minimizes the amount of motion by emulating the 'prefers-reduced-motion' media feature. Defaults to `'no-preference'`.

screen.name: screen
screen.signature: screen?: { /** * Page width in pixels. */ width: number; /** * Page height in pixels. */ height: number; };
screen.documentation: Sets a window screen size for all pages in the context. It can only be used when the viewport is set. Defaults to `{'width': 1280, 'height': 720}`.

timezoneID.name: timezoneID
timezoneID.documentation: Changes the context's timezone. See ICU's metaZones.txt for a list of supported timezone IDs. Defaults to what is set on the system.

userAgent.name: userAgent
userAgent.documentation: Specifies the user agent to use in the context. Defaults to what is set on the by the browser.

viewport.name: viewport
viewport.signature: viewport?: { /** * Page width in pixels. */ width: number; /** * Page height in pixels. */ height: number; };
viewport.documentation: Sets a viewport size for all pages in the context. null disables the default viewport. Defaults to `{'width': 1280, 'height': 720}`.

closeContext.name: closeContext
closeContext.documentation: Closes the current `BrowserContext`. If there is no active `BrowserContext`, this method will throw an error.

context.name: context
context.documentation: Returns the current `BrowserContext`. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between `Browser` and `BrowserContext`. If no `BrowserContext` has been initialized, it will return null.

isConnected.name: isConnected
isConnected.documentation: Indicates whether the CDP connection to the browser process is active or not.

newContext.name: newContext
newContext.documentation: Creates and returns a new `BrowserContext` if one hasn't already been initialized for the `Browser`. If one has already been initialized an error is thrown. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between `Browser` and `BrowserContext`. Due to this restriction, if one already exists, it must be closed first before creating a new one.

newPage.name: newPage
newPage.documentation: Creates and returns a new `Page` in a new `BrowserContext` if a `BrowserContext` hasn't already been initialized for the `Browser`. If a `BrowserContext` has already been initialized an error is thrown. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between `Browser` and `BrowserContext`. Due to this restriction, if one already exists, it must be closed first before creating a new one.

userAgent.name: userAgent
userAgent.documentation: Returns the browser application's user agent.

Browser.name: Browser
Browser.documentation: `Browser` represents the main web browser instance.

closeContext.name: closeContext
closeContext.documentation: Closes the current `BrowserContext`. If there is no active `BrowserContext`, this method will throw an error.

context.name: context
context.documentation: Returns the current `BrowserContext`. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between `Browser` and `BrowserContext`. If no `BrowserContext` has been initialized, it will return null.

isConnected.name: isConnected
isConnected.documentation: Indicates whether the CDP connection to the browser process is active or not.

newContext.name: newContext
newContext.documentation: Creates and returns a new `BrowserContext` if one hasn't already been initialized for the `Browser`. If one has already been initialized an error is thrown. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between `Browser` and `BrowserContext`. Due to this restriction, if one already exists, it must be closed first before creating a new one.

newPage.name: newPage
newPage.documentation: Creates and returns a new `Page` in a new `BrowserContext` if a `BrowserContext` hasn't already been initialized for the `Browser`. If a `BrowserContext` has already been initialized an error is thrown. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between `Browser` and `BrowserContext`. Due to this restriction, if one already exists, it must be closed first before creating a new one.

userAgent.name: userAgent
userAgent.documentation: Returns the browser application's user agent.

BrowserContext.name: BrowserContext
BrowserContext.documentation: `BrowserContext` provides a way to operate multiple independent sessions, with separate pages, cache, and cookies.

addInitScript.name: addInitScript
addInitScript.documentation: Adds a script which will be evaluated in one of the following scenarios: - Whenever a page is created in the browser context or is navigated. - Whenever a child frame is attached or navigated in any page in the browser context. In this case, the script is evaluated in the context of the newly attached frame. The script is evaluated after the document is created but before any of its scripts were run. This is useful to amend the JavaScript environment, e.g. to override `Math.random`. **Usage** An example of overriding `Math.random` before the page loads: ```js const browserContext = await browser.newContext(); await browserContext.addInitScript("Math.random = function(){return 0}"); const page = await browserContext.newPage(); await page.goto(url); ```

params.name: script
params.documentation: Script to be evaluated in all pages in the browser context.

browser.name: browser
browser.documentation: Returns the `Browser` instance that this `BrowserContext` belongs to.

params.name: cookies
params.documentation: The cookies to add to this BrowserContext.

clearCookies.name: clearCookies
clearCookies.documentation: Clears the cookies in this BrowserContext.

cookies.name: cookies
cookies.documentation: Retrieves the cookies in this cookies if no URLs are provided.

clearPermissions.name: clearPermissions
clearPermissions.documentation: Clears all permission overrides for the BrowserContext. ```js await context.clearPermissions(); ```

grantPermissions.name: grantPermissions
grantPermissions.documentation: Grants specified permissions to the BrowserContext. ```js await context.grantPermissions(['geolocation']); ```

pages.name: pages
pages.documentation: Returns a list of `Page`s that belongs to the `BrowserContext`.

setDefaultNavigationTimeout.name: setDefaultNavigationTimeout
setDefaultNavigationTimeout.documentation: Sets the default navigation timeout in milliseconds.

setDefaultTimeout.name: setDefaultTimeout
setDefaultTimeout.documentation: Sets the default maximum timeout for all methods accepting a timeout option in milliseconds.

setGeolocation.name: setGeolocation
setGeolocation.signature: setGeolocation(geolocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number; accuracy: number; })

params.name: geolocation
params.type: { latitude: number; longitude: number; accuracy: number; }

waitForEvent.name: waitForEvent
waitForEvent.signature: waitForEvent(event: "page", optionsOrPredicate: { predicate?: (page: Page) => boolean; timeout?: number; } | ((page: Page) => boolean))
waitForEvent.documentation: Waits for the event to fire and passes its value into the predicate function. Currently the only supported event is 'page' which when used will return the new Page that was created after `waitForEvent` was called.

params.name: optionsOrPredicate
params.type: { predicate?: (page: Page) => boolean; timeout?: number; } | ((page: Page) => boolean)

ConsoleMessage.name: ConsoleMessage
ConsoleMessage.documentation: ConsoleMessage objects are dispatched by page via the `page.on('console')` event. For each console message logged in the page, k6 browser delivers it to the registered handlers. ```js // Listen for all console log messages in the browser page and output them // in the test logs page.on('console', msg => console.log(msg.text())); // Listen for all console events and handle errors page.on('console', msg => { if (msg.type() === 'error') console.log(`Error text: "${msg.text()}"`); }); // Deconstruct console log arguments await msg.args()[0].jsonValue(); // hello await msg.args()[1].jsonValue(); // 42 ```

args.name: args
args.documentation: List of arguments passed to a `console` function call. See also `page.on('console')`.

page.name: page
page.documentation: The page that produced this console message, if any.

text.name: text
text.documentation: The text of the console message.

MetricMessage.name: MetricMessage
MetricMessage.documentation: MetricMessage objects are dispatched by page via the `page.on('metric')` event. For each metric that it measured and emitted for the page, k6 browser delivers it to the registered handlers. ```js // Listen for all metric messages in the page and call its tag method to // tag matching URLs with the new tag name. page.on('metric', (metric) => { metric.tag({ name: 'test', matches: [ {url: /^https:\/\/test\.k6\.io\/\?q=[0-9a-z]+$/, method: 'GET'}, ] }); }); ```

tag.name: tag
tag.signature: tag(tagMatch: { name: string; matches: { url: RegExp; method?: "GET" | "POST" | "PUT" | "DELETE" | "PATCH" | "OPTIONS" | "HEAD" | "TRACE" | "CONNECT"; }[]; })
tag.documentation: tag will match the given `tagMatch.matches` with the current metric's URL and name tags. When a match is found it will use `tagMatch.name` to replace the existing URL and name tag values. Doing this helps group metrics with different URL and name tags that, in fact, reference the same resource, allowing for correlation over time and reducing the cardinality of the metrics.

params.name: tagMatch
params.type: { name: string; matches: { url: RegExp; method?: "GET" | "POST" | "PUT" | "DELETE" | "PATCH" | "OPTIONS" | "HEAD" | "TRACE" | "CONNECT"; }[]; }

Cookie.name: Cookie
Cookie.documentation: Cookie represents a cookie in a BrowserContext.

url.name: url
url.documentation: The cookie's URL. Required unless one of domain or path are specified.

domain.name: domain
domain.documentation: The cookie's domain. Required unless one of url or path are specified.

path.name: path
path.documentation: The cookie's path. Required unless one of url or domain are specified.

expires.name: expires
expires.documentation: The cookie's expiration date as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.

sameSite.name: sameSite
sameSite.documentation: The cookie's same-site status. It can be one of `'Strict'`, `'Lax'`, or `'None'`.

CookieSameSite.name: CookieSameSite
CookieSameSite.documentation: CookieSameSite represents the same-site status of a cookie.

ElementHandle.name: ElementHandle
ElementHandle.documentation: ElementHandle represents an in-page DOM element.

$.documentation: Finds an element matching the specified selector in the `ElementHandle`'s subtree.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to query element for.

returns.documentation: `ElementHandle` pointing to the result element or `null`.

$$.documentation: Finds all elements matching the specified selector in the `ElementHandle`'s subtree.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to query element for.

returns.documentation: list of `ElementHandle`s pointing to the result elements.

boundingBox.name: boundingBox
boundingBox.documentation: This method returns the bounding box of the element.

check.name: check
check.signature: check(options: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions)

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions

click.name: click
click.signature: click(options: { button?: MouseButton; clickCount?: number; delay?: number; force?: boolean; modifiers?: KeyboardModifier[]; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; })

params.name: options
params.type: { button?: MouseButton; clickCount?: number; delay?: number; force?: boolean; modifiers?: KeyboardModifier[]; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; }

returns.documentation: promise that resolves when the element is clicked.

contentFrame.name: contentFrame
contentFrame.documentation: Get the content frame for element handles.

returns.documentation: content frame handle of the element handle.

dblclick.name: dblclick
dblclick.signature: dblclick(options: { button?: MouseButton; delay?: number; force?: boolean; modifiers?: KeyboardModifier[]; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; })

params.name: options
params.type: { button?: MouseButton; delay?: number; force?: boolean; modifiers?: KeyboardModifier[]; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; }

dispatchEvent.name: dispatchEvent
dispatchEvent.documentation: Dispatches a DOM event to the element.

fill.name: fill
fill.documentation: Fill the `input` or `textarea` element with the provided `value`.

params.name: value
params.documentation: Value to fill for the `input` or `textarea` element.

params.name: name
params.documentation: Attribute name to get the value for.

hover.name: hover
hover.signature: hover(options: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & KeyboardModifierOptions)
hover.documentation: Scrolls element into view and hovers over its center point.

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & KeyboardModifierOptions

inputValue.name: inputValue
inputValue.documentation: Returns `input.value` for the selected `input`, `textarea` or `select` element.

isChecked.name: isChecked
isChecked.documentation: Checks if a checkbox or radio is checked.

isDisabled.name: isDisabled
isDisabled.documentation: Checks if the element is disabled.

isEditable.name: isEditable
isEditable.documentation: Checks if the element is editable.

isEnabled.name: isEnabled
isEnabled.documentation: Checks if the element is enabled.

isHidden.name: isHidden
isHidden.documentation: Checks if the element is hidden.

isVisible.name: isVisible
isVisible.documentation: Checks if the element is visible.

ownerFrame.name: ownerFrame
ownerFrame.documentation: Returns the frame containing the given element.

returns.documentation: frame that contains the element handle.

press.name: press
press.documentation: Focuses the element, and then uses `keyboard.down` and `keyboard.up` with the specified key.

params.name: key
params.documentation: A keyboard key name or a single character to press.

screenshot.name: screenshot
screenshot.documentation: This method scrolls element into view, if needed, and then captures a screenshot of it.

scrollIntoViewIfNeeded.name: scrollIntoViewIfNeeded
scrollIntoViewIfNeeded.documentation: This method checks whether the element is actionable using provided options, and then tries to scroll it into view, unless it is completely visible.

selectOption.name: selectOption
selectOption.signature: selectOption(values: string | string[] | ElementHandle | ElementHandle[] | SelectOptionsObject | SelectOptionsObject[], options: ElementHandleOptions)
selectOption.documentation: Select one or more options of a `<select>` element which match the values.

params.name: values
params.type: string | string[] | ElementHandle | ElementHandle[] | SelectOptionsObject | SelectOptionsObject[]

selectText.name: selectText
selectText.documentation: Focuses the element and selects all its text content.

setChecked.name: setChecked
setChecked.signature: setChecked(checked: boolean, options: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions)
setChecked.documentation: Checks or unchecks the input checkbox element.

params.name: checked
params.documentation: Whether to check or uncheck the element.

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions
params.documentation: Options to customize the check action.

returns.documentation: promise that resolves when the element is checked or unchecked.

setInputFiles.name: setInputFiles
setInputFiles.signature: setInputFiles(files: File | File[], options: { timeout?: number; noWaitAfter?: boolean; })
setInputFiles.documentation: Sets the file input element's value to the specified files. To work with local files on the file system, use the experimental fs module to load and read the file contents. The element handle must be an [input element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input).

tap.name: tap
tap.documentation: Scrolls element into view if needed, and then uses `page.tapscreen` to tap in the center of the element or at the specified position.

type.name: type
type.documentation: Scrolls element into view, focuses element and types text.

params.name: text
params.documentation: Text to type into the element.

uncheck.name: uncheck
uncheck.signature: uncheck(options: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions)
uncheck.documentation: Scrolls element into view, and if it's an input element of type checkbox that is already checked, clicks on it to mark it as unchecked.

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions

waitForElementState.name: waitForElementState
waitForElementState.documentation: Returns when the element satisfies the `state`.

params.name: state
params.documentation: Wait for element to satisfy this state.

waitForSelector.name: waitForSelector
waitForSelector.signature: waitForSelector(selector: string, options: { state?: ElementState; } & StrictnessOptions & TimeoutOptions)
waitForSelector.documentation: Returns when the child element matching `selector` satisfies the `state`.

Frame.name: Frame
Frame.documentation: Frame represents the frame within a page. A page is made up of hierarchy of frames.

$.documentation: Finds an element matching the specified selector within the `Frame`.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to query element for.

returns.documentation: `ElementHandle` pointing to the result element or `null`.

$$.documentation: Finds all elements matching the specified selector within the `Frame`.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to query element for.

returns.documentation: list of `ElementHandle`s pointing to the result elements.

JSHandle.name: JSHandle
JSHandle.documentation: JSHandle represents an in-page JavaScript object.

asElement.name: asElement
asElement.documentation: Returns either `null` or the object handle itself, if the object handle is an instance of `ElementHandle`.

evaluate.name: evaluate
evaluate.documentation: Evaluates the page function and returns its return value. This method passes this handle as the first argument to the page function.

evaluateHandle.name: evaluateHandle
evaluateHandle.documentation: Evaluates the page function and returns a `JSHandle`. This method passes this handle as the first argument to the page function. Unlike `evaluate`, `evaluateHandle` returns the value as a `JSHandle`

returns.documentation: JSHandle of the return value of `pageFunction`.

getProperties.name: getProperties
getProperties.documentation: Fetches a map with own property names of of the `JSHandle` with their values as `JSHandle` instances.

returns.documentation: map with property names as keys and `JSHandle` instances for the property values.

jsonValue.name: jsonValue
jsonValue.documentation: Fetches a JSON representation of the object.

Keyboard.name: Keyboard
Keyboard.documentation: Keyboard provides an API for managing a virtual keyboard.

down.name: down
down.documentation: Sends a key down message to a session target. A superset of the key values can be found [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/UI_Events/Keyboard_event_key_values).

params.name: key
params.documentation: Name of key to press, such as `ArrowLeft`.

insertText.name: insertText
insertText.documentation: Dispatches an `input` event with the given `text`. This method does not emit `keyDown`, `keyUp` or `keyPress` events.

press.name: press
press.documentation: Sends a key press message to a session target. A press message consists of successive key down and up messages.

type.name: type
type.documentation: Type sends a `press` message to a session target for each character in text. It sends an insertText message if a character is not among valid characters in the keyboard's layout. Modifier keys `Shift`, `Control`, `Alt`, `Meta` are _not_ respected.

params.name: text
params.documentation: A text to type into a focused element.

up.name: up
up.documentation: Sends a key up message to a session target. A superset of the key values can be found [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/UI_Events/Keyboard_event_key_values).

params.name: key
params.documentation: Name of key to release, such as `ArrowLeft`.

Locator.name: Locator
Locator.documentation: The Locator API makes it easier to work with dynamically changing elements. Some of the benefits of using it over existing ways to locate an element (e.g. Page.$()) include: - Helps with writing robust tests by finding an element even if the underlying frame navigates. - Makes it easier to work with dynamic web pages and SPAs built with Svelte, React, Vue, etc.

clear.name: clear
clear.documentation: Clears text boxes and input fields of any existing values. **Usage** ```js // Clears the input field matching the selector. page.locator('input[name="login"]').clear(); ```

emulateMedia.name: emulateMedia
emulateMedia.documentation: This method changes the `CSS media type` through the `media` argument, and/or the `'prefers-colors-scheme'` media feature, using the `colorScheme` argument.

emulateVisionDeficiency.name: emulateVisionDeficiency
emulateVisionDeficiency.documentation: This emulates your website with the specified vision deficiency type. The supported types are: - none: default. - blurredVision: where vision is less precise. - protanopia: the inability to perceive any red light. - deuteranopia: the inability to perceive any green light. - tritanopia: the inability to perceive any blue light. - achromatopsia: the inability to perceive any color except for shades of grey (extremely rare).

mainFrame.name: mainFrame
mainFrame.documentation: The page's main frame. Page is made up of frames in a hierarchical. At the top is mainFrame. A page is guaranteed to have a mainFrame.

mouse.name: mouse
mouse.documentation: Returns the mouse instance to interact with a virtual mouse on the page.

on.name: on
on.documentation: page.on('metric') will register a background handler that will listen out for metrics that are measured and emitted for the page. When a MetricMessage is received by the handler, it can be used to group different metrics tagged with URL and name so that a correlation can be found and to reduce the cardinality of the metrics. **Usage** ```js // Listen for all metric messages in the page and call its tag method to // tag matching URLs with the new tag name. page.on('metric', (metric) => { metric.tag({ name: 'test', matches: [ {url: /^https:\/\/test\.k6\.io\/\?q=[0-9a-z]+$/, method: 'GET'}, ] }); }); ```

opener.name: opener
opener.documentation: Returns the page that opened the current page. The first page that is navigated to will have a null opener.

press.name: press
press.signature: press(selector: string, key: string, options: { delay?: number; noWaitAfter?: boolean; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; })
press.documentation: *NOTE** Use locator-based locator.press(key[, options]) instead. Focuses the element, and then uses keyboard.down(key) and keyboard.up(key). A superset of the `key` values can be found [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/key/Key_Values). Following modification shortcuts are also supported: `Shift`, `Control`, `Alt`, `Meta`, `ShiftLeft`. Holding down `Shift` will type the text that corresponds to the `key` in the upper case. If `key` is a single character, it is case-sensitive, so the values `a` and `A` will generate different respective texts. Shortcuts such as `key: "Control+o"` or `key: "Control+Shift+T"` are supported as well. When specified with the modifier, modifier is pressed and being held while the subsequent key is being pressed.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used.

params.name: key
params.documentation: Name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `ArrowLeft` or `a`.

params.name: options
params.type: { delay?: number; noWaitAfter?: boolean; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; }

reload.name: reload
reload.documentation: This reloads the current page Returns the main resource response.

screenshot.name: screenshot
screenshot.signature: screenshot(options: { clip?: { x: number; y: number; width: number; height: number; }; fullPage?: boolean; } & ScreenshotOptions)
screenshot.documentation: Returns the buffer with the captured screenshot from the browser.

params.name: options
params.type: { clip?: { x: number; y: number; width: number; height: number; }; fullPage?: boolean; } & ScreenshotOptions

setChecked.name: setChecked
setChecked.signature: setChecked(selector: string, checked: boolean, options: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions)
setChecked.documentation: Checks or unchecks the input checkbox element.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element.

params.name: checked
params.documentation: Whether to check or uncheck the element.

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; } & TimeoutOptions & { trial?: boolean; } & { position?: { x: number; y: number; }; } & StrictnessOptions
params.documentation: Options to customize the check action.

returns.documentation: promise that resolves when the element is checked or unchecked.

selectOption.name: selectOption
selectOption.signature: selectOption(selector: string, values: string | string[] | ElementHandle | ElementHandle[] | SelectOptionsObject | SelectOptionsObject[], options: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; })
selectOption.documentation: *NOTE** Use locator-based locator.selectOption(values[, options]) instead. This select one or more options which match the values from a <select> element.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used.

params.name: values
params.type: string | string[] | ElementHandle | ElementHandle[] | SelectOptionsObject | SelectOptionsObject[]
params.documentation: Options to select. If the select has multiple attribute, all matching options are selected, otherwise only the first option matching one of the passed options is selected. Object can be made up of keys with value, label or index.

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; }

setContent.name: setContent
setContent.signature: setContent(html: string, options: { timeout?: number; waitUntil?: "load" | "domcontentloaded" | "networkidle"; })
setContent.documentation: Set the supplied html string to the current page.

params.name: html
params.documentation: HTML markup to assign to the page.

setDefaultNavigationTimeout.name: setDefaultNavigationTimeout
setDefaultNavigationTimeout.documentation: This setting will change the navigation timeout for the following methods: - page.goto(url[, options]) - page.reload([options]) - page.setContent(html[, options]) - page.waitForNavigation([options])

setDefaultTimeout.name: setDefaultTimeout
setDefaultTimeout.documentation: This setting will change the timeout for all the methods accepting a `timeout` option.

setExtraHTTPHeaders.name: setExtraHTTPHeaders
setExtraHTTPHeaders.documentation: This sets extra HTTP headers which will be sent with subsequent HTTP requests.

params.name: headers
params.documentation: An object containing the additional HTTP headers. All header values must be strings.

setInputFiles.name: setInputFiles
setInputFiles.signature: setInputFiles(selector: string, files: File | File[], options: { timeout?: number; noWaitAfter?: boolean; })
setInputFiles.documentation: Sets the file input element's value to the specified files. To work with local files on the file system, use the experimental fs module to load and read the file contents. This method expects a `selector` to point to an [input element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input).

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used.

setViewportSize.name: setViewportSize
setViewportSize.documentation: This will update the page's width and height.

tap.name: tap
tap.signature: tap(selector: string, options: { force?: boolean; modifiers?: KeyboardModifier[]; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; })
tap.documentation: *NOTE** Use locator-based locator.tap([options]) instead. Tap the first element that matches the selector.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used.

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; modifiers?: KeyboardModifier[]; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; }

textContent.name: textContent
textContent.signature: textContent(selector: string, options: { strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; })

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used.

throttleCPU.name: throttleCPU
throttleCPU.documentation: Throttles the CPU in Chrome/Chromium to slow it down by the specified `rate` in CPUProfile. CPUProfile is a mandatory input argument. The default `rate` is `1`. **Usage** ```js page.throttleCPU({ rate: 4 }); ```

throttleNetwork.name: throttleNetwork
throttleNetwork.documentation: Throttles the network in Chrome/Chromium to slow it down by the specified fields in NetworkProfile. NetworkProfile is a mandatory input argument. **Usage** ```js page.throttleNetwork({ latency: 750, download: 250, upload: 250, }); ``` To work with the most commonly tested network profiles, import `networkProfiles` from the browser module. There are three profiles available: - `'No Throttling'` (default) - `'Fast 3G'` - `'Slow 3G'` **Usage** ```js import { browser, networkProfiles } from 'k6/browser'; ... // redacted const context = browser.newContext(); const page = context.newPage(); try { page.throttleNetwork(networkProfiles['Slow 3G']); ... // redacted ```

touchscreen.name: touchscreen
touchscreen.documentation: Returns the touchscreen instance to interact with a virtual touchscreen on the page.

type.name: type
type.signature: type(selector: string, text: string, options: { delay?: number; noWaitAfter?: boolean; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; })
type.documentation: *NOTE** Use locator-based locator.type(text[, options]) instead. Type the `text` in the first element found that matches the selector.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used.

params.name: text
params.documentation: The text to type into the element.

params.name: options
params.type: { delay?: number; noWaitAfter?: boolean; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; }

uncheck.name: uncheck
uncheck.signature: uncheck(selector: string, options: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; })
uncheck.documentation: *NOTE** Use locator-based `locator.uncheck([options])` instead. This method is used to unselect an input checkbox.

params.name: selector
params.documentation: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used.

params.name: options
params.type: { force?: boolean; noWaitAfter?: boolean; position?: { x: number; y: number; }; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; trial?: boolean; }

viewportSize.name: viewportSize
viewportSize.documentation: Returns the page's size (width and height).

waitForFunction.name: waitForFunction
waitForFunction.signature: waitForFunction(pageFunction: PageFunction<Arg, R>, options: { polling?: PollingMethod; timeout?: number; }, arg: Arg)
waitForFunction.documentation: Returns when the `pageFunction` returns a truthy value.

params.name: pageFunction
params.documentation: Function to be evaluated in the page context.

waitForLoadState.name: waitForLoadState
waitForLoadState.documentation: This waits for the given load state to be reached. It will immediately unblock if that lifecycle event has already been received.

params.name: state
params.documentation: Optional load state to wait for, defaults to `load`: - `'domcontentloaded'` - consider operation to be finished when the `DOMContentLoaded` event is fired. - `'load'` - consider operation to be finished when the `load` event is fired. - `'networkidle'` - **DISCOURAGED** consider operation to be finished when there are no network connections for at least `500` ms. Don't use this method for testing especially with chatty websites where the event may never fire, rely on web assertions to assess readiness instead.

waitForNavigation.name: waitForNavigation
waitForNavigation.documentation: Waits for the given navigation lifecycle event to occur and returns the main resource response.

waitForSelector.name: waitForSelector
waitForSelector.signature: waitForSelector(selector: string, options: { state?: "attached" | "detached" | "visible" | "hidden"; strict?: boolean; timeout?: number; })
waitForSelector.documentation: *NOTE** Use web assertions that assert visibility or a locator-based locator.waitFor([options]) instead. Returns when element specified by selector satisfies `state` option.

waitForTimeout.name: waitForTimeout
waitForTimeout.documentation: *NOTE** Never wait for timeout in production, use this only for debugging. Tests that wait for time are inherently flaky. Use `Locator` actions and web assertions that wait automatically. Waits for the given `timeout` in milliseconds.

workers.name: workers
workers.documentation: This method returns all of the dedicated WebWorkers associated with the page.

$.documentation: *NOTE** Use locator-based page.locator(selector[, options]) instead. The method finds an element matching the specified selector within the page. If no elements match the selector, the return value resolves to `null`. To wait for an element on the page, use locator.waitFor([options]).

$$.documentation: *NOTE** Use locator-based page.locator(selector[, options]) instead. The method finds all elements matching the specified selector within the page. If no elements match the selector, the return value resolves to `[]`.

Request.name: Request
Request.documentation: Request represents requests which are sent by a page.

allHeaders.name: allHeaders
allHeaders.documentation: An object with HTTP headers associated with the request. All header names are lower-case.

headers.name: headers
headers.documentation: An object with HTTP headers associated with the request. All header names are lower-case.

returns.documentation: object with HTTP headers associated with the request.

headersArray.name: headersArray
headersArray.documentation: An array with all the request HTTP headers. Unlike `Request.allHeaders()`, header names are not lower-cased. Headers with multiple entries, such as `Set-Cookie`, appear in the array multiple times.

returns.documentation: array of all the request HTTP headers.

headerValue.name: headerValue
headerValue.documentation: Retuns the value of the header matching the name. The name is case insensitive.

params.name: name
params.documentation: Header name to retrieve value for.

returns.documentation: value of the header matching the name.
boolean stating whether the request is for a navigation

postData.name: postData
postData.documentation: Contains the request's post body, if any.

postDataBuffer.name: postDataBuffer
postDataBuffer.documentation: Request's post body in a binary form, if any.

resourceType.name: resourceType
resourceType.documentation: Contains the request's resource type as it was perceived by the rendering engine. ResourceType will be one of the following: `document`, `stylesheet`, `image`, `media`, `font`, `script`, `texttrack`, `xhr`, `fetch`, `eventsource`, `websocket`, `manifest`, `other`.

response.name: response
response.documentation: Returns the matching `Response` object, or `null` if the response was not received due to error.

returns.documentation: `Response` object, or `null` if the response was not received due to error.

size.name: size
size.documentation: Returns resource size information for given request.

timing.name: timing
timing.documentation: Returns resource timing information for given request. Most of the timing values become available upon the response, `responseEnd` becomes available when request finishes.

Response.name: Response
Response.documentation: Response represents responses which are received by page.

allHeaders.name: allHeaders
allHeaders.documentation: An object with HTTP headers associated with the response. All header names are lower-case.

headers.name: headers
headers.documentation: An object with HTTP headers associated with the response. All header names are lower-case.

headersArray.name: headersArray
headersArray.documentation: An array with all the request HTTP response headers. Unlike `Response.headers()`, header names are not lower-cased. Headers with multiple entries, such as `Set-Cookie`, appear in the array multiple times.

returns.documentation: array of all the request HTTP headers.

headerValue.name: headerValue
headerValue.documentation: Returns the value of the header matching the name. The name is case insensitive. If multiple headers have the same name (except `Set-Cookie`), they are returned as a list separated by ``,``. For `Set-Cookie`, the `\n` separator is used. If no headers are found, `null` is returned.

params.name: name
params.documentation: Header name to retrieve value for.

returns.documentation: header value for the given name.

headerValues.name: headerValues
headerValues.documentation: Returns all values of the headers matching the name, for example `set-cookie`. The name is case insensitive.

params.name: name
params.documentation: Header name to retrieve values for.

returns.documentation: array of header values for the given name.

json.name: json
json.documentation: Returns the JSON representation of response body. Throws if response body is not parsable via `JSON.parse`.

ok.name: ok
ok.documentation: Contains a boolean stating whether the response was successful (status in the range 200-299) or not.

returns.documentation: boolean stating whether the response was successful

request.name: request
request.documentation: The request that was used to produce the response.

securityDetails.name: securityDetails
securityDetails.documentation: Security details associated with this response.

serverAddr.name: serverAddr
serverAddr.documentation: Returns the IP address and port of the server for this response.

returns.documentation: IP address and port of the server

status.name: status
status.documentation: Contains the status code of the response (e.g., 200 for a success).

statusText.name: statusText
statusText.documentation: Contains the status text of the response (e.g. usually an "OK" for a success).

size.name: size
size.documentation: The size of the response body and the headers.

returns.documentation: size of the response body and the headers.

url.name: url
url.documentation: Contains the URL of the response.

Touchscreen.name: Touchscreen
Touchscreen.documentation: Touchscreen provides an api for interacting with a virtual touchscreen. It operates in main-frame CSS pixels relative to the top-left corner of the viewport.

tap.name: tap
tap.documentation: Taps on the specified position (`x`,`y`), which internally dispatches a `touchstart` and `touchend` event.

url.name: url
url.documentation: Get the URL of the web worker.
